articles: Ready or not, enterprises are betting on AI | TechCrunch
The fixer's dilemma: Chris Lehane and OpenAI's impossible mission | TechCrunch
Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak to advise Microsoft and Anthropic  | TechCrunch
summaries: Major enterprise AI deals were announced this week, including partnerships between Anthropic-IBM and Anthropic-Deloitte, while Zendesk unveiled AI agents for customer service automation, though Deloitte faced criticism for AI-generated errors in a government report.

OpenAI's VP of global policy Chris Lehane faces challenges defending the company's actions around copyright issues with Sora, its video generation tool, and the environmental impact of its massive data centers in economically challenged areas.

Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has taken senior advisory roles at Microsoft and Anthropic, prompting concerns from Parliament's Advisory Committee about potential unfair access and influence in AI regulation and government affairs.

rawData.title: Apple ends support for Clips video-editing app
rawData.summary: Apple is discontinuing its Clips video editing app, removing it from the App Store on October 10th, 2025, though existing users can continue using the app on iOS and iPadOS without future updates.

rawData.title: Ready or not, enterprises are betting on AI | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Major enterprise AI deals were announced this week, including partnerships between Anthropic-IBM and Anthropic-Deloitte, while Zendesk unveiled AI agents for customer service automation, though Deloitte faced criticism for AI-generated errors in a government report.

rawData.title: How Verge readers, and writers, are managing our kids’ screen time
rawData.summary: A survey by Pew Research shows diverse approaches to managing children's screen time, with parents focusing more on content control and intentional usage than strict time limits, while 86% report having screen rules even if not strictly enforced.

rawData.title: The AirPods 4 and Lego’s brick-ified Grogu are our favorite deals this week
rawData.summary: Apple's base AirPods 4 are at their lowest price of $89 ($40 off), while Lego's 1,048-piece Star Wars Grogu set is discounted to $70, both available at major retailers alongside deals on Philips Hue bulbs and Sonos speakers.

rawData.title: It's not too late for Apple to get AI right | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Despite OpenAI's new ChatGPT app platform launch, Apple could still dominate AI-powered app interactions through an improved Siri and its extensive ecosystem of 1.5 billion iPhone users, though its AI efforts remain delayed.

rawData.title: American politics has devolved into shitposting and aura farming
rawData.summary: The article analyzes how political discourse in America has evolved into two main modes: 'aura farming' (attempts to look cool through posturing) and 'shitposting' (intentionally incoherent humor), exemplified by incidents like the viral Portland Frog protestor confronting federal agents.

rawData.title: Dreams of Another feels like a fever dream
rawData.summary: Dreams of Another is a surreal third-person exploration game where players use a gun that creates rather than destroys, navigating through dreamlike vignettes filled with strange conversations and deconstructed landscapes that can suddenly materialize into objects and characters.

rawData.title: Is the Coros Nomad really an adventure watch?
rawData.summary: A detailed review of the Coros Nomad adventure watch ($349) on the Tahoe Rim Trail finds it's a good watch at a competitive price point, but lacks specialized features for serious hikers and trail runners while being more oriented toward road runners.

rawData.title: Gear News of the Week: Intel’s New Chips Arrive, and Apple May Debut iPads and MacBooks This Month
rawData.summary: Intel announced its next-gen Core Ultra Series 3 (Panther Lake) CPUs, promising 50% faster performance and improved efficiency to compete with Qualcomm and Apple, with initial shipments starting by year-end and broader availability in January 2026.

rawData.title: The fixer's dilemma: Chris Lehane and OpenAI's impossible mission | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: OpenAI's VP of global policy Chris Lehane faces challenges defending the company's actions around copyright issues with Sora, its video generation tool, and the environmental impact of its massive data centers in economically challenged areas.

rawData.title: Hollywood has no idea what to do about AI
rawData.summary: Major Hollywood studios and executives are struggling to formulate a clear response to OpenAI's AI video generation technology Sora, while OpenAI continues to train on copyrighted content without explicit permission from rights holders.

rawData.title: OpenAI allegedly sent police to an AI regulation advocate’s door
rawData.summary: OpenAI reportedly sent sheriff's deputies to serve subpoenas to AI regulation advocates, demanding personal messages and communications with legislators, allegedly to investigate potential connections to Elon Musk's funding.

rawData.title: Bose is yanking key features from its SoundTouch speakers
rawData.summary: Bose will discontinue cloud-based features for its SoundTouch speakers in February 2026, including integrated Spotify access, multi-room playback, and app functionality, though Bluetooth and auxiliary connections will still work.

rawData.title: OpenAI is trying to clamp down on ‘bias’ in ChatGPT
rawData.summary: OpenAI reports that its new GPT-5 models show 30% less political bias than previous versions, based on internal testing using hundreds of politically charged and neutral questions across various topics.

rawData.title: These Steelseries Earbuds Have Barely Been Out of My Head in Months—and They’re on Sale
rawData.summary: The SteelSeries Arctis GameBuds, compatible with Xbox/PlayStation/Switch/PC, are on sale for $128 (down from $200) and feature low-latency wireless audio, 40-hour total battery life with case, and game-specific equalizer settings.

rawData.title: The billion-dollar infrastructure deals powering the AI boom | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Major tech companies are making massive infrastructure investments to power AI development, with Oracle securing $330B in cloud deals, Microsoft investing $14B in OpenAI, and Nvidia engaging in GPU-for-equity arrangements with AI companies.

rawData.title: You can still snag LG’s C4 OLED TV at half the price
rawData.summary: LG's 48-inch C4 OLED TV is on sale for $799.96 ($800 off) at Amazon, while the newer C5 model starts at $899.99, with both models offering excellent display quality, gaming features, and Dolby Vision/Atmos support.

rawData.title: Prezent raises $30 million to acquire AI services firms -- starting with founder's other company | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: AI presentation builder Prezent has raised $30M to acquire AI services firms, starting with Prezentium, a presentation services company co-founded by Prezent's own founder Rajat Mishra, as part of its enterprise-focused growth strategy.

rawData.title: Chrome will automatically disable web notifications you don’t care about
rawData.summary: Google Chrome is introducing an automatic feature that disables notifications from websites users consistently ignore, with less than 1% of web notifications currently receiving any user interaction.

rawData.title: Boox’s new smartphone-sized e-readers come with a steep price hike
rawData.summary: Boox has announced new P6 Pro e-readers in China featuring 6.13-inch displays, with the color model using E Ink Kaleido 3 technology and priced at $463, marking a significant price increase from previous models.
